abstract: After buying the video-sharing site YouTube nine months ago for $1.65 billion, Google plans to stop selling television shows on its homegrown video site.
snippet: After buying the video-sharing site YouTube nine months ago for $1.65 billion, Google plans to stop selling television shows on its homegrown video site.
lead_paragraph: After buying the video-sharing site YouTube nine months ago for $1.65 billion, Google plans to stop selling television shows on its homegrown video site.

headline.main: Google Is Closing Its Video Retailing Operation
headline.print_headline: Google Is Closing Its Video Retailing Operation
